summary: The Quapaw Tribal Settlement Act of 2025 authorizes the Secretary of the Treasury to pay $137,500,000 to the Quapaw Nation and certain members, following the recommendation of the United States Court of Federal Claims. It establishes a trust account for the funds, administered by the Secretary of the Interior. The bill outlines a process for the distribution of the settlement proceeds, including mediation and, if unsuccessful, a secretarial allocation process involving hearings and final distribution plan determination.
